data.title: Feature Request: Make API to open a new window of VSCode
data.body:
Hi everybody.

I haven't found a feature like mine so I am opening it.

# Description

I need a possibility to open a new window from my code.

I would like to have a method like this:

```typescript
export namespace vscode {
    /**
     * Opens a new window using the specified path as a target.
     * @param path An entry located at the path is opened in the new window. If it is undefined the new window is opened without target
     */
    export function createWindow(path: string | undefined): void;
}
```

And use it like this:
```typescript
const newWindowWithFile = vscode.createWindow('/etc/passwd');
const newWindowWithDirectory = vscode.createWindow('/mnt');
const newWindow = vscode.createWindow();
```

# Unresolved Questions

Should the method return `Promise` to schedule actions after a new window is opened?

Should the method return `Promise` to return an error if a new window isn't opened?

Regards,
Alexey

data.title: Find processes hanging and piling up

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Loading folders with many files (in my case loading the home folder with `code .`) leads to hanging find processes piling up. This seems to be related to the issues stated in #11181. 

`find -L . -not ( ( -name .git -o -name .svn -o -name .hg -o -name .DS_Store ) -prune ) -type f`

Every process uses ~100% of the assigned CPU core which eventually leads to the whole CPU being used.

- VSCode Version:
Version 1.8.1
Commit ee428b0
Date 2016-12-19T14:41:20.664Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0

- OS Version: 
Ubuntu 16.04 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Go to directory with many files
2. Run `code .`

Thanks

data.title: Prompting user to install dependent extensions should be a real dialog
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. install an extension like "CMake Tools" 
2. you see a message showing up asking to install the dependencies of the extension too

Imho this should be a native dialog and not using the notification API for user input.

data.title: Explorer twistie spacing and issues
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.9.0-insider (d384271ffb5655cee1ddf8f93f51cd892ee2cc40, 2017-01-03T07:05:16.958Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.1.0

---

The changes to the explorer to make it work when our Seti icon theme is enabled have some serious drawbacks. When not using icons, the spacing from twistie to label is now looking broken:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/21603994/1464e064-d1a1-11e6-8566-00809db17b9d.png)

Also, the rename box is no longer filling the full width:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/21604004/21b4f8f8-d1a1-11e6-9ffb-5ee522ca53e2.png)

The changes to make it work with Seti icon theme should only be applied when an icon theme is active.

Finally, I am no longer seeing a "..." when the label overflows:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/21748902/4b3f7916-d591-11e6-9d26-3c41b0807022.png)

data.title: Use Chrome's network stack for installing extensions
data.body:
Related issues: #17397 #17360 #17574
Related PRs: #17786

Using Node's network stack just causes **way** too many proxy headaches.

data.title: Terminal window vertical scroll bar can't be selected
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open terminal window by pressing CTRL+`
2. Show vertical scroll bar by pressing ENTER key few times
3. Move the mouse over the vertical scroll bar

User cannot drag vertical scroll bar - it is draggable only if the mouse is over the right half of the scroll bar - only then the scroll bar is "highlighted" indicating that the user can now drag it. How "wide" the are that can be highlighted by moving the mouse over it depends on the width of VSCode window - sometimes the scroll bar becomes highlighted when the mouse is at the middle of the scroll bar but if now user resizes VSCode window width by few pixels, "highlighting" area becomes smaller and eventually for some VSCode window widths - the scroll bar cannot be highlighted at all.

data.title: Terminal window loses characters when resized horizontally
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VSCode and maximize its window
2. Press CTRL+` to open a terminal - a standard text "Microsoft Windows [Version 6.1.7601] ... Copyright (c) 2009 Microsoft Corporation.  All rights reserved." is shown
3. Horizontally resize (shrink) VSCode window - make it small enough to hide part of the text in terminal
4. Expand/maximize VSCode window - some of the text in the terminal is now gone

Some screenshots are  attached.

Before shrinking:
![before-shrink](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7610713/21602469/d633f806-d19c-11e6-8856-7017bdfc6ffc.jpg)

After shrinking:
![after-shrink](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7610713/21602471/db17b362-d19c-11e6-9891-6bc3158cd56e.jpg)

After expanding (note how the text now says "All ri" only):
![after-expand](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7610713/21602475/df957014-d19c-11e6-981e-537600ca123b.jpg)


Sometimes while shrinking VSCode window horizontally, the lines in terminal window are duplicated:
![after-shrink-multiple-lines](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7610713/21602504/3b88d988-d19d-11e6-8601-4b7c63eaf456.jpg)

data.title: PHP 7 Return Type Declarations
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0-insider
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.2

The IDE shows a syntax error when I use the PHP 7 Return Type declarations.
**The Error**:
file: 'file:///Users/keith/Development/keith/PHP/test.php'
severity: 'Error'
message: 'parse error, expecting `'{'''
at: '2,1'
source: ''

Here is the [PHP Documentation](http://php.net/manual/en/functions.returning-values.php#functions.returning-values.type-declaration) regarding return types.

Here is a simple piece of code that causes the syntax error:
```
<?php
function hello(string $name): string {
    return "Hello $name!\n";
}
```

I hope it's nothing to major to fix since the last version of PHP 5 is no longer actively supported, as of December 31. It's only receiving security updates.

data.title: "Please set up the launch configuration file for your application" when launch.json exists in new project
data.body:
It seems the first time I open a new folder with an existing launch.json file, I'm asked to set up the config file until I edit and save it.

- Clone something with a launch.json file, like https://github.com/sgtoj/dynamo-localdb
- Open in Insiders and press F5
- It opens the existing launch.json file with the message in the title
- If I make any edit and save the file, then when I press F5 it will start debugging.

data.title: Reloading window in zen mode goes into fullscreen mode without zen
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Enter Zen Mode
2. Press <kbd>F1</kbd>
3. Search for and execute `Reload Window`
4. You are now in full screen mode instead of zen mode

This causes the menu bar to disappear, and I could not figure out how to get it back because I didn't know I was in full screen mode instead of zen mode.

Basically it seems as if zen mode is getting turned off but fullscreen mode is not when the window is reloaded in zen mode.

data.title: Issues with Setting Debug Breakpoints via F9
data.body:
Version 1.9.0-insider
Commit f2379e882b415e2c503a723776c4431a40d7c1aa
Date 2017-01-02T07:11:43.247Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0

##### Steps to Reproduce:
- Create a JS and/or TS (with source mapping)
   - My Example: [sgtoj/dynamo-localdb](https://github.com/sgtoj/dynamo-localdb)
     - Script: `./scripts/test.js`
- Set debug point on couple random lines using the F9 key.
- Enter debug mode.
  - Normally, the breakpoints will randomly move around.
- Set more debug point on other lines.
   - Normally, the setting a new breakpoint affects the other existing points.

##### Issues
- Breakpoint set via F9 key randomly move once debug is executed.
  - Normally, but not always, it will move down a line.
  - Somes times, breakpoints are removed altogether. 
- While debug mode is active, VS Code or Node-Debug doesn't respect the line number a new breakpoint (via F9) was set. 
- While debug mode is active, existing breakpoints will randomly move around when another breakpoint (via F9) is added.

Breakpoints Set via F9 - [Better quality](http://i.imgur.com/GD24ODW.gifv)
![breakpoints set via F9](http://i.imgur.com/d1AUu3a.gif)

Breakpoints Set via Mouse Clicking on the Sidebar (set on the same lines above)
![breakpoint server via clicking](http://i.imgur.com/hVxxRHJ.gif)

##### Troubleshooting
- Affects multiple systems and OS (Windows 10 Insiders and Ubuntu 16.10)
- Affects multiple Node versions: v6.9.2 and v7.3.0
- *Seems* to only affect breakpoints set via F9 key.
- *Seems* affect only VS Code Insiders 
- Enabling or Disabling SmartStep doesn't change the outcome.
  - Module in the GIFs are written in TS before compiled.

##### launch.json
```
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "Launch - Test Script",
            "type": "node2",
            "request": "launch",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/scripts/test.js",
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "outFiles": [],
            "stopOnEntry": false,
            "sourceMaps": true,
            "smartStep": true
        }
    ]
}
```

Also posted issue at Microsoft/vscode-node-debug2#71.

data.title: Feedback - Improve loading time
data.body:
Bonjour,
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|

---

Steps to Reproduce:
0. Make sure VSCode do not have ANY extension installed
1. Go to http://www.passmark.com/products/apptimer.htm
2. Download Pass App Mark Timer. Note : I did'nt know this application until today. May be there is a more accurate way to make these type of measurments.
3. Configure it properly such a way VSCode is loaded with no file
4. Follow similar process with Notepad++

Here are the results I get (Surface Book, i7, 8 GB)
C:\Program Files (x86)\Notepad++\notepad++.exe - 3 executions
0.4030 sec
0.3738 sec
0.3741 sec

C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\Code.exe - 3 executions
2.9274 sec
2.7750 sec
2.6008 sec

So on average this is .38 sec. vs 2.76 sec.
This means VSCode is 7 time slower than Notepad++

This might become more and more important for users since I realize I use more and more VSCode to edit any kind of file using the right click on the filename. Each time I'm a little bit furstrated by the load time (even if I understand why 

Best regards, Philippe

data.title: It would be nice to have the close button on the left, or tabs with the same width.
data.body: - VSCode Version: Version 1.8.1 (1.8.1) - OS Version: MacOS/OSX The title says it all. A simple patch that "fixes" the issue is in attach. It's not so much because OSX has the close button on the left, but more because it's inefficient to have to move the mouse to close two tabs in a sequence. Think of chrome. It does it very well. When you close a tab, before resizing the tabs, the tab on the right will end up with its close button on the same location as the closed tab - that is, right under the mouse. This can be accomplished without resizing the tabs by placing it on the left. It even matches the OSX button placement. For me the patch works, but I would prefer to still get automatic updates without having to reapply it. I don't know if this can be applied as an extension - didn't research it. If yes, do let me know. I'll implement it. [Code.patch.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/681142/Code.patch.txt)

data.title: Multiple background gradations
data.body: Hi, I've the issue that my editor consists of multiple background gradations of different sizes (see screenshot at the end). This issue appears independent of the color theme and the viewed file type, but of course within the theme's color space. The darker background is changing in widths based on the different code blocks' widths and the currently cursor position. The code block the cursor currently is in has always full width. But this issue not only appears in the editor, but also in the extensions sidebar (see second screenshot). So it is totally unrelated to the color theme or the type of file viewing. ![vscode-multiple-backgrounds-sidebar](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1077917/21592395/70e54516-d10d-11e6-8d15-a3b68c7a2f55.png) - VSCode Version: 1.8.1 - OS Version: macOS Sierra (10.12.1)

data.title: [css] Disable prefixes from CSS/SCSS autocomplete suggestions
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Win7 64

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open/create a CSS file and type: `transition-`
2. The autocomplete window will show suggestions for `-webkit-transition`- or `-o-transition-` that pretty much fill up the popup.

![2017-01-02_12h01_40](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6965667/21591774/d15656c4-d0e5-11e6-9a94-91f20d7e128a.png)

I found that annoying since most of the time I use snippets or some kind of Autoprefixer to handle that, and currently seems that there is no option to disable them.

Can I suggest something like `css.suggest.vendorPrefix` ?
Thanks!

data.title: Open multiple folders in one instance
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Sierra 10.12.2

I would like to open several projects in only one instance of VScode. That would be of a great help.

data.title: Missing rule - Insert space after and before braces when format
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: OSX Yosemite

There is a rule `javascript.format.insertSpaceAfterOpeningAndBeforeClosingNonemptyBrackets` which allow to add space, but none for `braces`. Or I couldn't find it.

Related to https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/13401, seems it was possible before but since the behavior has been changed on TS directly, it doesn't seem to exist a way to setup this now for braces only. (the former rule would change the behavior for both braces and brackets, for what I could understand)
